intro: Arthrostylidium leptophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and inland areas. The plant has small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It is adapted to dry conditions and can thrive in well-drained soils. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
